info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER... NORTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND SOUTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mars, or 8 miles east of Cranberry, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vandergrift, Plum, Hampton Township, New Kensington, Lower Burrell, Harrison Township, Arnold, Tarentum, Natrona Heights, Brackenridge, Ford City, and Gibsonia. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 32 and 36, and between mile markers 42 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
